A navigator uses celestial bodies and shipping lanes to determine routes. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 16 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 11 [Navigator](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3598) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 146 **Perception** +9 **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) +6, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +11, [Sailing Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +14, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +8, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +9 **Str** +0 **Dex** +2 **Con** +1 **Int** +4 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +0 **Chart a Course** ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561)) By spending 10 minutes of work and succeeding at a DC 22 [Sailing Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) check, the navigator plots an optimal course. The severity of [environmental conditions](/Rules.aspx?ID=2768) during the journey is reduced by one step for 24 hours (two steps on a critical success). This changes moderate damage to minor damage, winds that create greater difficult terrain cause only difficult terrain, and so on.
**Sailing Specialist** For encounters involving navigation or sailing, the navigator is a 4th-level challenge. **Items** [Dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3), scroll case with ship's charts, [Writing Set](/Equipment.aspx?ID=63) --- **AC** 17 **Fort** +7 **Ref** +8 **Will** +9 **HP** 30 --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** dagger +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 1d4+4 piercing plus navigator's edge **Melee** fist +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 1d4+4 bludgeoning **Ranged** dagger +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 1d4+4 piercing plus navigator's edge **Navigator's Edge** The navigator's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 damage when on a ship.
